sentences.english: Then this chapter tries to make a comparison between the primary words of the two languages.
sentences.chinese: 第二章“汉语孳乳字与英语次生词对比”。

definition: nonstandard form of a Chinese character
archaic (and simpler) form of a Chinese character
see 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character indicating an idea, such as up and down/also known as self-explanatory character
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
seal script used throughout the pre-Han period

Six Methods of forming Chinese characters, according to Han dictionary Shuowen 說文|说文 - namely, two primary methods: 象形 (pictogram), 指事 (ideogram), two compound methods: 會意|会意 (combined ideogram), 形聲|形声 (ideogram plus phonetic), and two transfer methods: 假借 (loan), 轉注|转注 (transfer)
phonetic component of a Chinese character
ideogram plus phonetic (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/also known as phonogram, phonetic compound or picto-phonetic character
semantic component of a phono-semantic character (e.g. component刂[dao1] in 刻[ke4])
the meaning of a phonetic loan character 假借字[jia3 jie4 zi4] acquired from a similar-sounding word (e.g. 而[er2] originally meant "beard" but acquired the meaning "and")
